channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Inaki Berroeta, who is set to lead a combined Vodafone-TPG, says the new player has the capacity to steal business customers from rivals Telstra and Optus.
item.title: Incoming Vodafone-TPG boss puts rivals on notice ahead of 'remote' merger

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: There are no options without risk but the priority should be to return children to their classrooms and end the inferior education of the computer screen.
item.title: Schools should be allowed to reopen soon - but with a caveat

item.dc:creator: Waleed Aly
item.description: We should take this chance to heed the warning from those nations that are presently unravelling.
item.title: Look at the US and the UK and be glad we're not like them

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 24, 2020

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A 2017 report containing a series of controversial policy recommendations has been dusted off as the government looks at fresh ideas to boost economic growth.
item.title: Micro-reforms from university fees to council red-tape to lift post-virus economy

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Australia records lowest number of COVID-19 cases in 24-hour period since early March, US death toll passes 46,000, Australia's death toll stands at 76

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: It comes as the sector braces for an exponential increase in people seeking help to manage their drinking due to the coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Boost to drug and alcohol service funding during COVID-19 pandemic

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Coronavirus will not stop Ralph Edwards from honouring the Anzacs this year.
item.title: Ralph the 101-year-old veteran to honour Anzacs in isolation

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, April 24

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Carlton's Madison Prespakis is one of AFLW's best players just two seasons after being drafted.
item.title: Carlton's Madison Prespakis dual best and fairest before turning 20

item.description: The finest photos from the wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: Police are desperate to understand how a routine traffic stop left four officers dead, but are also appalled that photographs and footage of their fallen colleagues were posted on social media within hours of their deaths.
item.title: Police desperate to make sense of tragic crash

item.description: The casts of old TV westerns quickly fill a vacuum.
item.title: Save the cheap stuff for your car's tank, not your own

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: What will be Australia’s tallest building, towering more than 360 metres above Melbourne’s CBD at Southbank, has been approved by the state Labor government.
item.title: Twisting tower to be Australia's tallest and a lifeline to the economy

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The coronavirus tracing app will get its own piece of legislation to ensure privacy concerns are dealt with.
item.title: New laws to cover coronavirus app after fears police could access data

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Sky Racing and Channel Seven have enjoyed massive spikes in viewership over the past two months as options for live sport remain restricted to horse racing.
item.title: Sky Racing, Seven enjoy racing ratings boost

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: 'I Do Drive Thru' was launched three weeks ago by four marriage celebrants and it expanded into Queensland this week.
item.title: Bride and vroom-vroom: Drive-through weddings launch in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Raelene Castle's resignation leaves Rugby Australia with a chasm to fill. One new director could be the person it looks to in the short term.
item.title: The mystery man who could step in to fill rugby's leadership void

item.dc:creator: Caroline Wilson
item.description: An announcement is likely to connect with the Victorian government's forthcoming decision regarding coronavirus restrictions in the lead-up to May 11.
item.title: AFL could resume in June as revamped fixture release pushed back

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: As Facebook works with police to identify graphic images published after the horror crash, experts say abhorrent content laws weren't framed to deal with such a situation.
item.title: Christchurch laws 'don't apply' to Eastern Freeway crash images on Facebook

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Flinders Street Station and the MCG were among the several buildings lit up as a mark of respect for the officers.
item.title: Melbourne landmarks lit in blue to honour fallen police

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Hawthorn have agreed to put negotiations with the Tasmanian Government to extend their deal to play games in Tasmania on hold until later this year
item.title: Tasmanian government puts Hawthorn contract talks on hold

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: The beleaguered rugby boss called interim chairman Paul McLean on Thursday evening to hand in her resignation.
item.title: Raelene Castle resigns as Rugby Australia chief executive

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: It's the annual event which changes hundreds of lives and is worth tens of millions of dollars - but this year's NFL Draft will rely on the sport's executives' strength of internet connection as much as their player evaluation.
item.title: Virtual boos and WiFi fears: How the 2020 NFL Draft will be like no other

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Annabelle lost her partner two months before their child's birth. This weekend she will remember him in a new way.
item.title: 'He was a legend': Widow keeps war veteran's legacy alive for their daughter

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: One in five Australians say they will keep their new hygiene practices once the coronavirus ends, while 10 per cent say they'll spend less money.
item.title: Australians prepare for long-term belt-tightening in COVID-19 downturn

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: Foul play may be behind the disappearance of a man whose car was left beside a Queensland highway.
item.title: Missing man's car ditched on Queensland highway

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: The boat, which has been linked to 21 coronavirus deaths and more than 650 infections nationwide, was led out of Port Kembla on Thursday, bound for the Philippines.
item.title: Ruby Princess at centre of outbreak in Tasmania, chief medic says

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The AFL plans to break the fixture into phases when they return to play in quarantine hubs so they can reassess the situation regularly.
item.title: Flexible fixture a key as AFL plans season in phases

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: The WA government has unveiled $154.5 million in relief for landlords, businesses and employees in the construction industry impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: WA coronavirus: $154.5 million cash splash to keep WA apprentices employed and tenants in their homes

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: A meeting between Cricket Australia and the players union on Friday is set to be postponed.
item.title: Cricket Australia, players in stand-off over potential pay cuts

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A young woman accused of stabbing a man to death on a Gold Coast footpath will remain behind bars charged with murder.
item.title: Accused Surfers Paradise killer remains behind bars

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: NRL fans will be up in arms as Channel Nine warns the governing body against over-promising and under-delivering.
item.title: Channel Nine slams brakes on 'premature' May 28 NRL restart

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Former arts minister Don Harwin has listed his Elizabeth Bay apartment for sale, prompting speculation he will quit politics.
item.title: Former NSW minister selling Sydney unit, prompting retirement talk

item.description: The dawn service is cancelled at Gallipoli and on the western front, but the day will be honoured across Europe in virtual ceremonies.
item.title: All quiet on the European front for Anzac Day services

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Rees Powell will give evidence for an eighth day and is expected to finish going through the 98 critical fibres relating to this trial.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: ChemCentre expert reveals mammoth task of wading through thousands of fibres

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: A mortgage broker allegedly involved in a horrific crash in which four police officers died spoke about his Porsche online and posted videos of the luxury cars.
item.title: Mortgage broker who allegedly left scene of horror crash posted Porsche videos online

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Aussie shoppers frustrated by empty shelves at major supermarkets have caused a surprising surge in market share across Australia's independent grocers.
item.title: Independent supermarkets the big winners from virus panic buying

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The NRL will allow extra players to warm up for games ahead of kick-off in case there are late withdrawals due to coronavirus.
item.title: NRL clubs get extra standby players to cover for positive COVID-19 test

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Australia slipped five places in the global press freedom index, with AFP raids targeting reporters and cost-cutting in the industry cited as threats.
item.title: Government 'absolutely committed' to press freedom as Australia drops in rankings

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Games with no crowds could be soulless affairs, but veteran TV producer David Barham has come up with a plan to revolutionise the way football is televised.
item.title: New angles and 'Gogglebox' fans: how to televise footy without crowds

item.description: Celebrities like actor Woody Harrelson and rapper Whiz Khalifa are the "super- spreaders" of misinformation during times of crisis, experts say.
item.title: Celebrities 'super-spreaders' of fake news, Queensland researchers say

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: While the May 28 return has the blessing of one leading authority, another expert suggested that date was "premature".
item.title: 'Football is not an essential service': Experts divided on NRL return

item.dc:creator: Aimie Rigas
item.description: “It's very sad that an Australian government is considered so untrustworthy," said one reader.
item.title: Topic of trust dominates reader discussion of government's COVID-19 app

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Andrews government has blocked opposition parties' demands for greater oversight of the state's emergency measures.
item.title: Victorian government blocks opposition calls for scrutiny of pandemic response

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: After hundreds of Phillip Island's little penguins died of heat stress over the summer, wooden burrows are being used to protect them on extremely hot days.
item.title: As climate heats up, artificial burrows could help penguins stay cool

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The head of St Andrew's Cathedral School, Dr John Collier, advises aspiring teachers to follow their hearts and to specialise at university.
item.title: Teaching has been a lifelong vocation for this headmaster

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Secondary schools are still waiting for guidance on how to handle crucial assessments for year 12 students who are being taught remotely.
item.title: Schools left in dark about how to proceed with year 12 assessments
